intro: Solanum toralapanum var. subintegrifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaf nightshade, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant features simple, ovate to lanceolate leaves with a smooth or slightly toothed margin. Its small, yellowish-green flowers are clustered in umbels and bloom during the rainy season. The fruit is a globose berry that turns red when mature, containing several seeds.
